info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cabarrus, northeastern Mecklenburg and north central Union Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Downtown Concord, or near Harrisburg, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Downtown Concord, Kannapolis, Northeast Charlotte, East Charlotte, West Concord, Mint Hill, Unionville, Harrisburg and Hemby Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
